TextLibrary.Text: Bartonia
The largest city belonging to the Knights of Agaria.
Dhun-Kor
This Dwarven Outpost does much trade with the Orcs, Goblins and Ogres of Kor.
Drakenburg
This citadel is built at the foot of the Drakenburg mountain - home to a huge Green Dragon.
Dragonrealm
Few mortals have entered the Dragonrealm and returned to tell the tale.
Ehlariel
The Citadel of Ehlariel is home to the Ice Queen, Ehlanna, one of the two rulers of the High Elves.
Enmouth
Enmouth is the largest trade port in the Selentine Empire.
Gallia
The golden-walled city of Gallia is the oldest citadel in the Borderlands.
Gluk
Gluk is a city full of Ogres in Southern Kor, ruled by a cruel and powerful Ogre Mage.
Gruuldok
Gruuldok is the birthplace of the Great Orc, Gruulkar, current leader of the Orcs of Kor.
Horned Temple
The Minotaur Firewalkers within these walls await the return of their God, Sartek.
Hyaan
Hyaan is home to the Hyaa clan of Gnolls, a fierce and dangerous group of creatures.
Jarl's Keep
Jarl, Lord of the Frost Giants, lives in this massive citadel.
Jotun's Keep
Jotun, Lord of the Fire Giants, lives in this huge citadel.
Kal-Ungar
The evil machinery of the Dark Dwarves can be heard from this citadel churning all day and all night.
Bane's Citadel
This citadel is home to Lord Bane, Master of the Undead, also known as the Dark Horseman of Death.
Ohtar
Ohtar was the home of Sartek, Lord of War and King of the Minotaurs, before he was defeated by Lord Bane.
Silvermyr
Silvermyr is the only forest on the mainland of Etheria where the Wood Elves may still be found.
The Trarg
Nomadic tribes of barbarians roam these plains with their herds of horses.
Tusk
A central gathering place for many tribes of Minotaurs, Tusk was once home to the arena where Sartek staged the battles of the K'Varr.
Ylarie
Partially left in ruins by Orc invasions many centuries ago, Ylarie was once a beautiful Elven city.
Arik's Arena
This is the home of Arik, the minotaur king.
Bloodstone
This rock formation marks the place where Lord Bane was once defeated by the Elven Mages.
Chilblain's Lair
The Frost Dragon, Chilblain, lives here.
Dragon Cave
This cave belongs to a Green Dragon who has lived within sight of Drakenburg for many centuries.
Dragons' Graveyard
The bones of Dragons litter the ground in this silent valley.
Dark Path Shrine
Members of the Dark Path Cult are said to worship at this shrine.
Dragon Shrine
This is an ancient Elven shrine, originally used to worship the Frost Dragons who lived in these mountains.
Dark Stables
Lord Bane keeps his mounts stabled in these dark uninviting caves.
Egor's Bridge
Egor the Troll lives under this Bridge.
Gildine Sewers
These sewers carry away the wastes from the busy citadel of Gildor.
Hagstone
The Hagstone is home to a large coven of Harpies.
Ice Crystal Mine
The Elves have dug deep into the Ice here, mining precious metals.
Morass' Lair
The Swamp Dragon, Morass, lives here.
Old Outpost
This was once a Selentine military outpost, but Elenian archers destroyed it.
Ogre's Tower
Two Ogres live in this tower on the edge of the Barad Dumyr.
Scorpions' Cave
Giant Scorpions inhabit this cave and terrorize any passersby.
Swamp Cave
An ancient Flame Dragon is said to slumber in this cave.
Skell Marshes
These marshes are home to all manner of foul and twisted creatures.
Slaver Camp
Minotaur Slavers often land here and raid southern Selentia and the Trarg.
Ancient Grove
An ancient order of Elenian Druids worship at this Grove.
Royal Crypt
The Kings of Theira are buried here.
Troll Hole
Trolls live in this cave deep within the marsh.
Umbra's Lair
The Flame Dragon, Umbra, lives here.
Volcano
This Volcano is home to a large number of Fire Elementals.
Worm Cave
Giant worms live here. The Orcs of Kor highly prize them for their meat.
Wargstone
Out west of Gruuldok, the plains are infested by Wargs.
Wasp Hive
Giant Wasps inhabit a hive within this cave.
Wyvern's Roost
A pack of Wyverns live on a peak at the end of a long, dry valley.
Elenia
The Elenian Knights guard the western forests of Agaria from Selentine invasions.
Gildor
The Gildine Knights are the wealthiest and most powerful order of the Agarian Knights.
Siria
The Sirian Knights are famed for their mighty Paladins.
Theira
The Theiran Knights protect the northern borders of Agaria from hordes of ravenous Trolls.
Ruins of Artum
This gateway once guarded the path through the Sserin Jungle.
Maethelburg
Maethelburg is home to the Riverguard - an order of Warriors who protect the Borderlands.
Agarian Pass
Dwarves guard this pass over the Mountains of Agaria.
Skellheim
The Duke of Skellheim is rumored to be a master of the Dark Arts.
Barthel
This village is a trade center for Southern Selentia.
Hammer Pass
This Pass is usually well-guarded, since any invading Orc Tribes invariably seek to enter Agaria through here.
Alfland
The men of Alfland trade freely with the Wood Elves of Silvermyr.
Blood Moon
The Blood Moon Orcs can see keenly in the dark. They launch their raids at night.
White Skull
It is said that the Shaman of the White Skull Orcs can raise the dead.
Bone Head
The Bone Head Orcs pierce their ears and noses in dozens of places, filling them with animal bones.
Snake Fang
The Snake Fang Orcs are rumored to have a poisonous bite.
Gork
Gork is home to a band of vicious Ogres.
Drong's Tower
Drong the Ogre lives in this tower. Drong's feasts are legendary - he is a magnificent cook.
Northern Kor
Northern Kor is a relative wasteland. Too many wars between the Orcs and the dragons have scarred the ground.
Dragon Valley
This long valley is the entrance to the Dragonrealm.
Valley of Kings
There is rumored to be an Ancient Dwarven Tomb somewhere in this valley.
Hornburg
The Dwarves named this peak Hornburg, since it marked the entrance to the homelands of the Minotaurs.
The Pike
This pike is ritually decorated with the heads of those foolish enough to trespass in the Realms of War.
Giants' Walk
Giants are frequently seen traveling through these lands.
Blackhoof
The fierce Blackhoof tribe rule this village.
Weret
This village of shapechangers is feared by the many tribes of Minotaurs to the south.
Ar
The chilly Plains of Ar are home to many barbaric tribes.
Gornak's Gap
Garnak's Gap is one of the few passes into the Realms of Death. It is inhabited by bands of ravenous Undead Orcs.
Skullguard Keep
Skullguard Keep guards the High Elven lands from the Undead in the north.
Iceguard Keep
Iceguard Keep is one of the two Keeps the High Elves use to defend their lands from Lord Bane.
Ragnar's Coast
Ragnar, the ancient Frost Dragon, lives in the mountains nearby and claims this coast as his own.
Eldros' Tower
This tower was the home of the ancient Elven Healer, Lord Eldros.
Graww
Graww was the birthplace of Gornak Elfeater, one of the mightiest Orcs to ever invade the civilized lands.
Sea of Ice
Beyond the northern borders of the Realms of Death lies an endless sea of jagged shards of ice.
Lake of Blood
It is often said that Lord Bane draws some of his power from the red waters of this lake.
Tirianin
Tirianin is the busiest port of the High Elves on the mainland.
Sartek's Maze
Many twisted and misshapen creatures inhabit these twisting valleys.
Bonebridge
Doomknights guard this bridge that leads towards Lord Bane's citadel.
The Wastelands
There is very little to see upon these cold windy plains.
Hidden Valley
An ancient secret road of the Dark Dwarves leads up this valley.
Bloodspring
This secret spring is the source of the Lake of Blood.
